definition: pun/play on words/a phrase with a double meaning
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

sentences.english: So presumably this, too, is a pun.
sentences.chinese: 因此据我揣测这也是一个双关语。

sentences.english: Too much paronomasia will make your essay confusing.
sentences.chinese: 使用太多双关语会让文章意思不清。

sentences.english: I think journalism is the last refuge for puns.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得新闻业是双关语最后的阵地了。

sentences.english: Puns, to be fair, are usually impossible to translate faithfully.
sentences.chinese: 公平地说，双关语通常不可能被忠实地翻译出来。

sentences.english: Puns are a form of wordplay that exists in all languages.
sentences.chinese: 双关语是所有语言里都存在的一种文字游戏。

sentences.english: Puns are one of the indirect promoting tools favored by admen.
sentences.chinese: 双关语是广告设计者喜爱使用的宣传方式之一。

sentences.english: These word games we call puns.
sentences.chinese: 这些文字游戏被我们称为双关语。

sentences.english: The faithful herdman's art in Lycidas is a double one.
sentences.chinese: 虔诚的牧人在里是一个双关语。
这里还是一个双关语之地？

sentences.english: Puns translatability has been a hot debate in the field of translation.
sentences.chinese: 双关语的可译性一直是翻译界争论的热点。

sentences.english: The pun translation is always difficult; even some people consider puns as untranslatable.
sentences.chinese: 双关语的翻译历来困难，有人甚至认为它是不可译的。

sentences.english: As for a pun itself, it is almost untranslatable.
sentences.chinese: 就双关语本身来说，它几乎是不可译的。

sentences.english: The jokes themselves are often based on puns and wordplay.
sentences.chinese: 这些笑话多是建立在双关语和文字游戏的基础之上。

sentences.english: Hes always punning and I dont find it funny.
sentences.chinese: 他老是使用双关语，我觉得很没意思。

sentences.english: This little piece of code here that I did.
sentences.chinese: 这个双关语用的不太好。

sentences.english: Punning is one of the most common rhetorical devices used in advertisement .
sentences.chinese: 双关语是英语广告中一种较为常见的修辞手段。

definition: to make a pun/to have a double meaning/double entendre
to use sth as a metaphor
